Description:
Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), X__Junior (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: File Encryption/Decryption Via Gpg4win From Suspicious Locations
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\gpg.exe' or process_path like '%\gpg2.exe') and product = 'gnu privacy guard (gnupg)' and description = 'gnupgâ€™s openpgp tool') and command like '%-passphrase%' and (command like '%:\perflogs\%' or command like '%:\temp\%' or command like '%:\users\public\%' or command like '%:\windows\temp\%' or command like '%\appdata\local\temp\%' or command like '%\appdata\roaming\%'))
